website_summaries.verdict: Sophisticated in structure and focused on consistent, rich-tasting coffee.
pros: Lined with a metal carafe that keeps coffee evenly heated for several hours
Able to heat coffee up to 205°
Have coffee ready any time of the day with the Delay Brew feature

website_summaries.verdict: The Mr. Coffee Smart Optimal Brew makes sense for those who get a thrill from commanding their coffee maker by mobile app but not for people seeking strong java flavor.
pros: The Mr.Coffee Smart Optimal Brew whips up drinkable pots of coffee in 10-cup batches, is a snap to clean, supports a weekly schedule and can be controlled via Belkin's WeMo mobile app
cons: The coffee the Mr. Coffee Smart Optimal Brew makes is weak
The coffee maker doesn't talk to other WeMo smart-home products and lacks an IFTTT channel
It only holds enough water and grounds for one brew cycle

customer_reviews.title: Decanters/carafes start to leak after a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.text: In last 3 months we got 2 of them. In both coffeemakers decanters/carafes start to leak after a couple of weeks. Amazon replaced the first one, but time expired for the second and I tried to call support number but after being on hold for 54 minutes I give up. Never ever I’ll buy a Mr. Coffee brand again. 👎
customer_reviews.author: Ya Happy Bee

customer_reviews.title: LASTED 2 MONTHS then died an unceremonious death.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in the end of March 2018. It's dead now, June 2018. Return window passed, service window passed. All this does now is loooong beep when it's turned on. Doesn't heat at all. Crap. Loved the IDEA of this, but the thermal carafe didn't keep things as warm as our old one..Now it's just landfill. PASS ON THIS ONE! I did a LOT of research before I shelled-out money for this, and picked this over others. I regret it. Why the heck are these coffee makers so darned expensive?? All these programming functions are unnecessary and just break the thing. Just make a simple one that WORKS!!
customer_reviews.author: RD Luck

customer_reviews.title: Nice Coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice (but not perfect) coffee maker. I like: - The thermal carafe instead of a heating pad - It brews really fast - Removable water well makes filling easy - Has a water filter I don't like: - The thermal carafe could be insulated a little more - The water filter is in a flip cover on the basket that holds the grounds; makes cleaning and filling the basket clumsy - The maker has a timer that tells you when your coffee is two hours old. Just a useless, unnecessary feature to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Plastic taste hard to clean due to reservoir
customer_reviews.text: Works well, we like the overall coffee maker, but the plastic taste from the water reservoir has been nearly impossible to remove. The instructions say nothing about this in terms of the pre-cleaning and setup process. Next step for us will be soaking with vinegar and baking soda and scrubbing it a few more times... Edit: Did that and the reservoir still smells like brand newly minted Chinese plastic manufacturing. Yum. I hope someone at Mr Coffee sees all these reviews about this. I wonder if they cheapened the manufacturing process. Because if they are all like this, and you don't smell or taste the plastic, there is something wrong with your olfactory senses.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Good BUT...
customer_reviews.text: It makes wonderful coffee and is a cinch to use, however, since day one, pot one, it has leaked a bit from where the plastic band meats the metal pot. I cannot tell if it is condensation building underneath the plastic or if perhaps when the coffee drips into the pot is pools and leaks down. In the end it wasn't so sever that we felt compelled to send it back, but I thought others should know.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Requires too much coffee and too fine a grind
customer_reviews.text: After 1.5 months of experimentation, the we never found the optimal combination of the amount of coffee and fineness of grind. The coffee was so incredibly weak that it required twice as much coffee as our previous coffeemakers or the Zojirushi EC-YSC100 Fresh Brew that we bought as a replacement to this. It also required us to grind the coffee so finely, that it it had a muddy texture. No complaints about construction and ease of use - it just doesn't make a good cup of coffee, which is its only reason for existence.
customer_reviews.author: Michael in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, will break in a few months.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Mr. Coffee pot. This model keeps having an issue where the LED light goes out and the last one I had about 8 months the cleaning light kept coming on. So after cleaning it every week for a month I gave up. It has a nice look and the thermal carafe is really nice but I like to set my coffee pot for the next day and when you can't read the display to do that it's frustrating. I really hope they improve on these two points but in the meantime I would just buy a regular coffee pot and pour it into a thermal carafe or buttler to keep it warm.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan 1978

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the filter Don't use the filter Don't use the filter
customer_reviews.text: Update - part of the brew basket fell off after my return window with Amazon. This is not a great coffee maker. Not recommended. Poor design. Beware of the filter that's included. Brewed my first pot. Half of it all over the countertop. Brewed the second pot sitting in a baking pan. Half of it in the baking pan. Took out the filter and brewed my coffee in the baking pan. It seemed to function fine.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Coffee Pot!
customer_reviews.text: We had a Mr Coffee thermal pot that brewed its last pot. Alas, there are more available! This one shows the old one needed to be replaced badly! This policy is easy to fill the water reservoir as you take the tank to the sink and slide it in place. The top of the pot is easy to open (the old one took brute force). The grounds holder on the new one is on the side and easy to take out, dump and refill. The coffee pot itself, is a fabulous thermal pot that keeps the coffee hot for hours without making it taste "old". Nice job Mr. Coffee!
customer_reviews.author: mariet43

customer_reviews.title: Favorite machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my all-time favorite coffee maker, and I use the heck out of it. Brews nicely, keeps coffee hot for forever, don't have to remember to turn off a burner, love that you can remove the water receptacle for easy filling, easy clean indicator and cycle. My house was broken into and along with several other things, they stole this coffee maker. :( A friend bought me a new fancy one at 3x the cost as a nice gesture to make me feel better, but I returned it just so I could buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: wetarugula

customer_reviews.title: Then got a crappy pot of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Leaks, yes I emptied the pot, no I didn't overfill the reservoir, I know how to make a pot of coffee. Tried two different permanent filters, one Mr. Coffee brand, both overflowed, paper filter...overflowed. I ended up having to change how much I ground my coffee and change how much grounds I put in just to get it to not overflow. Then got a crappy pot of coffee. Returned worst coffee maker I've used in years. Looks impressive in pictures, works horribly on my counter. Returned, complete disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wham-Bam it don't work.
customer_reviews.text: It works very well, like the removable water tank and the filter access. Coffee is hot to the last drop and no heating plate to draw electricity. No noise very little mess and great tasting coffee. FOLLOW-UP: Filters are a joke, about every 5th pot of coffee the brew comes out like weak tea. Look in the brew basket and find only half the ground coffee got wet. I am now perforating the filter disc rendering them useless, or eliminating them all together. Follow up: Removing the filter doesn't help, I've tried several different things to male it work. Guess I now have a white elephant, or a very expensive carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Coffee is ready in the morning
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been really good. When it brews a pot, the steam is fairly heavy and when you pull the pot out, it drips water on the counter. I periodically find coffee grinds in the brewed pot, but that may be me trying to add more grinds to get a stronger brew. Overall I like that my coffee is ready in the morning and it does brew a good cup when you find a coffee you like. Without the minor issues I mentioned I would have given it 5 stars. With that said, if it lasts longer than a year, I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come in 12 cup. I need my morning coffee and I like to know when it's ready. Set up is easy. Makes great coffee. I had ordered a Black & Decker and it was awful. This one is great. Keeps coffee hot all day. Would definitely order again if it was the right size for me. My previous Mr. Coffee still works after about 7-8 years. Just thought it was time to replace. The gasket was getting loose and I was nervous it would start leaking. It doesn't and will use as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with results
customer_reviews.text: Love the self-cleaning feature. It is easy to set up for overnight or immediate use. Very important to make sure the carafe is empty if you plan to make a full pot, or it will overflow. It does shut off if you remove the carafe to fill a cup in the middle of a brewing cycle. Coffee stays hot even longer than when the timer goes off to tell you that it is no longer at the peak temperature. Outside of thermal carafe stays cool to the touch as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: S. Norton

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This Mr. Coffee was the first coffee maker that my husband and I purchased back in 2014. We tried a Keurig out for a while when that fad hit. And after a few months, it wasn't the same, coffee taste was burnt and bitter and just wanted a good cup of coffee again in the mornings. After a lot of research, and also looking at expensive products on the market, we decided to go true and trusted again. Couldn't be more pleased! Great cup of coffee every morning again.
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaTomato24

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just over a year.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this one because everyone kept forgetting to shut off the regular coffee pot. Once we got in the habit of checking the carafe to make sure there was no left over coffee in it (after numerous overflows everywhere), the coffee maker worked great-ish. It brewed fairly quickly and the pot kept the coffee hot without the burned flavor. However, we could never get it completely cleaned so the clean light was always on. If you didn't clean out the reservoir often, it would smell funny. The breaking point was when the reservoir started leaking. There is no way to fix it. So, we are now looking for another coffee maker. :(
customer_reviews.author: Danny T

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond happy! I've had cuisinarts, keurigs, Hamilton beach, and on and on. This little miracle machine is the best. Such a robust pure taste to your coffee (I don't know why there is such a difference, but there IS!!). Also, the carafe keeps your pot HOT for so long. I'm an avid coffee hog, and have spent so much $ on different machines over the years...For $50 bucks this one hit the TARGET. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlyann W.

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee fast and kept hot for hours in thermal carafe
customer_reviews.text: Brews good coffee for a very good price and in a hurry to. The new plastic smell from the water tank is taking its sweet time fading and the sharp single chirp it emits when finished seems like it would wake my wife, but so far not so. The thermos works great and keeps the coffee hot for hours without need for a hot plate. You'll need to buy a filter of some sort. I use a permanent screen filter and line it with a paper. It seems to slow the passage of water through the grounds and yield a bit stronger brew.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed Would not Recommned
customer_reviews.text: Most the reviews I read for this product were good which I based my purchase on as I was looking for a good product with a stainless steel carafe. I was extremely disappointed ...the coffee was very week even after adding extra grounds. There was a odor which I discovered came from the plastic water tank which after several washing could not get rid of. I have a older Mr. Coffee that I have gone back to. The price was little more that I wanted to spend, but based on the Mr. Coffee brand I decided to purchase. Better off getting a less expense coffee maker and definitely not Mr. Coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Lori g

customer_reviews.title: Deeply deeply disappointed. Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! I'd give it minus 5 stars if I could. Incredibly disappointed. Within a week, the coffee began to overflow all over the counter, flooding drawers and the floor with coffee (and the carafe was empty); the dripping mechanism simply did not work. Also grounds were present every time in the carafe. I eventually got so frustrated with it after so many overflows (about 6 times in 4 weeks) that I threw it away. I've bought thousands of products on Amazon for nearly 12 years. This is the worst product I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Why would you buy this?
customer_reviews.text: You're probably reading this because you're interested in a coffee maker which puts water at 200+ degrees on ground up coffee beans. Which means you want hot coffee...... This coffee pot is not heated. This coffee pot is insulated. In order for coffee to heat the pot you must make a lot of coffee. I'm a single male and Im not the type to want company for breakfast. I'm not the type to make a massive pot of coffee. So I spent $80 on cold coffee.....and the pot keeps it cold....its insulated, remember? I'm going to make a youtube video making fun of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Paasch

customer_reviews.title: Fast delicious coffee every morning.
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it 5 stars, but this is the 3rd Mr. Coffee we have bought, because the first 2 just stopped working after 5 years. We have tried other brands of coffee maker, but prefer this because the stainless steel carafe keeps the coffee hot for hours and hours. It makes a full pot of coffee very fast compared to a Hamilton Beach coffeemaker with a stainless steel carafe. Also the Hamilton Beach carafe does not keep the coffee hot. This coffeemaker has a yellow light that comes on when cleaning is needed. Very easy to clean. Hope this one last longer,
customer_reviews.author: karen s wessel

customer_reviews.title: Don’t listen to bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee pot! You have to run a few cycles with water and a few with coffee to get the smell out of it. Once you’ve done that, the coffee is great and quick! I really like the no-spill pour top and the removable water container. I would buy this again!!!
customer_reviews.author: john snyder

customer_reviews.title: Brew basket issues ruins this product!
customer_reviews.text: The #1 issue I have with this type Mr. Coffee coffee maker is the brew basket “system”. A cheaply made spring release mechanism for water/coffee to drain into the carafe only works some of the time. About half the time, after only a few uses, the spring and rubber washer doesn’t open up properly so coffee overflows all over the counter. Cheap basket design makes this otherwise nice coffee maker a really average (at best) coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brown

customer_reviews.title: My fiends favorite coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a neighbor of mine, a stubborn and picky coffee lover who’s beloved pot expired the day before they were to leave on a multi day work trip. They were going to spend $200 for a particular name brand, but instead I ordered this for them. Now every time I see them I hear the glowing reviews of this Mr. Coffee. They LOVE the removable water reservoir. I’m told the insulated carafe will keep coffee warm all day. And more, I’m told it makes the best tasting coffee they’ve ever brewed. Now I have coffee pot envy, at least I’m welcome to share.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriend as a Christmas present and its still going strong. Huge difference in coffee quality from what we had before. Love the pot, it keeps the coffee in there nice and hot for hours some how. Was a shocker when i went to grab a cup of coffee 2 hours after brewing and to my amazement, it was still hot! She loves how quick it brews and how the water tank comes right off for easy refills. Shes in love with it and it was so worth!
customer_reviews.author: Fenrir

customer_reviews.title: HOT and STRONG Coffee - Not Dripping
customer_reviews.text: The long and the short of it? It makes STRONG coffee and it makes it FAST and it makes it HOT. No dripping at all for now. No hot plate is a win. Separate water reservoir (detachable) is a huge win for tidiness. Separate coffee reservoir (detachable) is likewise nice and tidy. Timer is super simple. Carafe keeps coffee warm and untainted by external heating. I have no idea how durable this setup is. We make about 500 pots of coffee a year, so lets see how this sucker does. So far though, highly impressed!
customer_reviews.author: LFP

customer_reviews.title: Really does make good coffee!!
customer_reviews.text: After much research, we bought this easy-to- use Mr Coffee. The coffee is smooth and very good. The carafe keeps it hot for a long time. It would be nice to have a 12 cup model like this, but we need to cut back anyway. We usually make 2-2.5 pots a day. Although cleaning is easy ( I used the MR Coffee cleaner) it does take about an hour by the time you run the clean cycle and rinse the machine twice. I had Cuisinarts for many years prior to this but had to keep replacing them lately.
customer_reviews.author: dog lover1

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for 8 years - great product
customer_reviews.text: Thermal carafes are the way to go -- no burnt coffee flavor, and stays warm for hours. We're about to purchase a second one of these coffeemakers. We got our first one in 2012 (8 years ago), and have used it 2-4 times a day nearly 365 per year. Eventually, the digital display became too dim to see, but the coffeemaker itself still works. Replacing it now, as the water reservoir seal is starting to leak. We did need to get a replacement carafe after the first one came apart (after about 4-5 years of use).
customer_reviews.author: S. Archer

customer_reviews.title: I'm in like, not love
customer_reviews.text: It's functional. We haven't had any problems, although we are not using the filter, which is in an odd, non-functional location. It is slightly annoying to fill both the water and the coffee sides, and the carafe does a mediocre job of keeping my coffee warm more than a couple of hours. But for the money, can't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: C B

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking (just not at this one)
customer_reviews.text: First, the carafe is fantastic. It keeps the coffee very hot. Now the bad - it’s a very poorly designed unit, and ours made pretty awful coffee. The “filter” that comes with the unit isn’t a coffee filter, but instead is a water diffuser needed to spread the water over the coffee. It’s clearly intended as a profit-producing consumable part, and ours was coming apart after just a few days. Our carafe developed a rattle on day two that indicated a loose part in the lid. We sent it back. Too many problems.
customer_reviews.author: MarkF

customer_reviews.title: First one lasted 10 years, great cup of java!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Mr. Coffee of same exact model. The first one lasted 10 years or so with 5 coffee drinkers. That’s two pots a day everyday! We a bit of coffee snobs and this produces a great cup of coffee. My sister has a Bun and it is no doubt faster but you can’t get it to produce an equivalent cup. Regarding some feedback on it leaking. It sure does if you forget to empty the carafe or do not securely push the carafe all the way in. We have done both but no fault of the maker. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Lefor

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this coffee maker for 16 months and brew 1 pot per day. The thermal carafe is stained very badly and flakes, despite regular cleaning as recommended. The water reservoir is starting to come apart. I imagine I will be looking to purchase a new coffee maker soon. Before purchasing this Mr. Coffee I had always bought Zojirushi coffee makers and I was much more satisfied with the Zojirushi products. Update: Water reservoir has come apart. I have contacted Mr. Coffee. I am 4 months outside of the warranty so I assume I will have to pay for a new reservoir. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Second one leaks in the same place as the first one...give it about 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: The is the second identical model. Both the one we had before and this one leaks in the same place at about the -year mark. The leak is below the filler tub. On our last one it started like this and got to the point where it flowed out on the counter. This has nothing to do with overfilling. It is either a design or manufacturing quality flaw. Fooled me the first time, their bad, fooled me the second time, my bad. There will not be a third time.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not HOT Enough
customer_reviews.text: I haven't measured the temp, but a fresh pot of coffee is not as hot as I expected it to be. Once I add creamer, I have to reheat it in the microwave. I expected it to be so hot that I could only sip it but that is not the case. It could be gulped easily without any fear of scalding. Everything else works perfectly so far. It's a Great Looking Machine, I just wish the coffee was hotter. I will probably return and try the Zojirushi.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Great pressure processed coffee within 3 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Must use filtered or distilled water (tastes wonderful) for long life of this machine. Otherwise, calcium & lime builds up inside faster than you can clean it. If you don't, you must run clean cycle very ofter, or machine will last only a year or less. That said, this is the absolute best Mr Coffee Maker. The carafe keeps coffee hot for an hour and more. The machine pressure processes coffee through the filter basket, extracting the best of your fresh grounds beans within 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: CentralCoastShopper

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy coffeemaker that looks awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second coffee maker of this particular style and we love it. Our first lasted at least 2 years of heavy daily use. My husband got a little over zealous in cleaning it and pulled the inside hose loose and couldn't get it reattached. We saved the nice carafe, so have a back up for our new one. The stainless steel finish gives the countertops a little elegant flair! Very sturdy machine. Tip: order the replacement water filters thru Amazon instead of big box stores for a tremendous savings!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly McMillan

customer_reviews.title: This is our 4th one
customer_reviews.text: These don’t last forever, but we just bought our 4th one. We were on treated well water before and that water is not good any appliance. Just moved to city water and hope to get more life out of this one. We like the insulated carafe and removable water tank. Never was a fan of the burner just cooking the coffee. We now have multiple carafes to use when we have guests over. Wish the carafe held more volume as it is smaller than other options, but we’ve yet to find a better coffee maker with an insulated carafe. Recommend buying the generic bulk pack of filter disks and replacing them as recommended.
customer_reviews.author: mustardchips

customer_reviews.title: Best all around drip machine I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Let my just start by saying I really love coffee. Like, a lot a lot. I know that in the coffee snob world, drip machines are blasphemy, but if you tune in your grind and amount of beans just right with a nice burr grinder, this machine will put out a killer cup of joe. I bought the metal basket to go with it and no longer have any use for paper filters. Whenever I'm making coffee for a group or just know that ill be wanting several cups in rapid succession, this is my go to. For everything else there's the pourover, aeropress, and fridge made cold brew. This machine does us right. Would happily buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Rick'll FixIt

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: if you care about your coffee. The primary issues are that the basket isn't big enough to brew a good cup of coffee without overflowing onto your counter, so if you use the golden ratio, two tablespoons of coffee per six ounces of water, you get a big mess instead. In addition the water isn't anywhere near hot enough. Your looking for a minimum of 170 degrees F, this doesn't even get close. As for durability mine stopped working a week out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water everywhere every time you make a pot of coffee
customer_reviews.text: As much as I like this coffee pot the reason it got a 3-star review was because every time we make a pot of coffee a bunch of water leaks all over. I purchased two of these coffee makers one for my home and one for my mother-in-law. Both of them have the same issue. As much as we like the coffee pot we would not buy it again because of that
customer_reviews.author: Alissa V.

customer_reviews.title: Unbreakable carafe
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new coffee maker for our new RV. Main thing we wanted is one with an unbreakable carafe due to when traveling the glass carafes are susceptible to breakage. This one has an added bonus that the carafe is more like a thermos in that it doesn't require a burner to keep the coffee hot. We can take the pot once it is done brewing and take it where ever we are sitting enjoying our morning coffee and not have to get up for a refill. Keeps the coffee very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: The first pot tasted terrible. Like it had chemicals or plastic in it
customer_reviews.text: I followed instructions for washing before use. The first pot tasted terrible. Like it had chemicals or plastic in it. Tried another coffee, same horrible taste. So I used plain water in it. The water had the same horrible taste. I felt half sick after trying the coffee and chemically flavored water. I am 78 and have drank coffee since I was young and never had a coffee pot that made such horribly tasting coffee. Had many Mr. Coffee glass pots that worked great. I would not recommend this for anyone. I replaced it with a KRUPS and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: ... this coffee maker about 2 years ago and I loved it. It worked great and kept the coffee ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this coffee maker about 2 years ago and I loved it. It worked great and kept the coffee hot while the outside stayed cool, so you could set the pot on a table. It worked well for about a year and then the "clean" light started coning on very often, even if we had jut run the cleaning cycle and changed the filters. Then before long it started taking a very long time to brew a pot of coffee, sometimes 20 minutes for a full pot. I can see it's on it's way out. A $70 coffee maker should last more than 2 years. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bostrom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect coffee anyone?
customer_reviews.text: This is it. Don't spend more on other coffee makers. Mr. Coffee hit the nail on the head with this one. Mr. Coffee said they would: 1 Brew at the right temp. 2 Brew quick. 3 Limit air exposure. Yes, yes, and yes. I think the carafe is fantastic. No burner to wonder about. Coffee hot and fresh for hours. I did my research. I was suspect as to whether Mr. Coffee could pull all these things off. They did. We tried percolators in the past because drip brew couldn't cut it. Well this one does. I recommend running at least 6 pots of water before the first pot. Get this one, you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: trekkerman

customer_reviews.title: Good looking coffee maker, but performance sucked within a month.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the look of the coffee maker. Worked flawlessly for the first few weeks and was able to create a whole pot of coffee within minutes. But after a month, the time to brew a whole pot is now over 15 minutes. We've cleaned it every two weeks, but the cleaning light continually signals it needs another cleaning. Kind of disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker. Has all the basics, minus 1.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. I've never owned or used a thermal coffee pot or brewer before this. The base doesn't heat the pot like traditional coffee makers. This one makes the coffee nice and hot and pours it into the carafe which just maintains the temperature. The side loading coffee entry and pull away water reservoir is a nice touch. Only thing I wish it had is a small window or some sort of signifier that would show the level of coffee left in the carafe. I'm sure this would raise the price but it is somewhat annoying not knowing if I have enough left to pour a whole cup or only enough to fill half.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: 5 out of 5 thermal carafes have leaked...
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffeemaker. I’m on my 3rd one. It makes good coffee and I LOVE being able to carry the water reservoir to the sink instead of trying to fill it with a pitcher. BUT, I have one major complaint that has now happened 5 times. The thermal carafe begins to leak after a short while, from below the pour spout, where the stainless body meets the black, plastic exterior. Black & Decker has been very good comping replacements, but after all these years, what haven’t they fixed the problem? Note: We wash the carafe by hand. Never in the dishwasher!
customer_reviews.author: KittyKatz

customer_reviews.title: Thermal Carafe Stinks!
customer_reviews.text: On the whole the brewing unit isn't bad. Easy to program, easy to fill with water and to access the coffee basket. The stainless steel thermal carafe on the other hand is a horror! The inner surface is brushed stainless steel and it stains with time leaving a perpetual stale coffee scent. I've tried the manufacturers recommendation (vinegar) with no effect. Tried baking soda, hydrogen peroxide, salt, scouring powder, and nothing will get the stains (and lingering odor) off of the inside of the carafe. I would not recommend this unit or buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tagg B

customer_reviews.title: Strong plastic smell and tastes even after more than 50 times of use
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker has a forever plastic smell and taste. In addition, cleaning inside the machine is tricky as there are parts that I can't see and clean. During the last cleaning, some residue (maybe calcium...not sure) got flushed out from the inside. It was gross and I never had that with other coffee makers. I have used it about 20 times. Every time I suffered to finish the coffee with the hope that the next cup would taste better. But I can't take it anymore and have to dump it!
customer_reviews.author: Petti

customer_reviews.title: Mr coffee is mister trouble to me,
customer_reviews.text: I have called their service people twice to see if i was doing something wrong. They would put me on hold then hang up after about 5 to ten minutes. the coffee maker I have now is the replacement from the first shipment. It has the same problem. the reservoir holds enough water for ten cups. I fill the water and coffee so it's ready to brew when i get up. Half the water has run out all over night. Now I am stuck with this badly designed product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our second of this model. Makes great coffee and purchased at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second coffee pot just like this. The first arrived with very dim digits in the viewing window. Made it difficult to set time and delay start time. But it made great coffee. At about 2 years of age, the display stopped working all together and we could no longer set the delay on starting time. So I ordered a new pot. This one has a bright display and everything works great. Mr. Coffee said this model was discontinued and that the recommended replacement is a 12 cup very similar model for $127. I elected to get another 10 cup for $52. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Couldbfishin

customer_reviews.title: Love it except for the leaks!!
customer_reviews.text: Unit leaks underneath, leaves dark rings of coffee spots ever since I've had it. Called the 1-800 # today in booklet & explained the problem, they were great, sending me a NEW unit!!!!! Told me to keep the decanter & cut the cord plug in off before I throw it in the trash so no one will try to use it, didn't give me any problems at all, purchased in January this year so it wasn't even a year old yet.
customer_reviews.author: Firewoman

customer_reviews.title: Great buy- good coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Love that the coffee doesn't sit on a hot plate to stay warm. Coffee stays hot without boiling off all the water. Coffee easy to make. Like the removable water reservoir. Simple refill. Like the stainless steel pot. Would like for it to be easier to clean and would've liked to be able to put it in the dishwasher. Difficult the get your hand or brush in pot to get it really clean. Best coffee we ever made. So glad we bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Richie

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased
customer_reviews.text: While unlike other reviews, this pot works fine, for now... it says it's a ten cup pot. I noticed that it did not seem the 10 cups was going as far as it did with my last pot (which was a 12 cup, but I only brewed 10 cups most of the time.) That's because I measured, and the reservoir only holds 7 cups of water. Will NOT purchase this coffee pot in the future, nor do I recommend its purchase. It is also difficult to clean and set up for use. Don't waste your money. You can find a cheaper, better pot for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Thermal carafe is durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the same style which lasted honestly, about 20 years ! We like having coffee always available. This unit does not keep coffee hot because it doesn’t have a heated element, so coffee doesnt evaporate or get stronger. That means after a few hours we use microwave. The taste for us is good, not as good as our favorite McDonalds , but that could be the cheap coffee I buy!😀
customer_reviews.author: RBreeze

customer_reviews.title: Worst tasting coffee I ever had
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee maker to replace a similar one; one we had for many years. I ran water through it 3 times before I made coffee. The brewed coffee had a terrible plastic smell to it and tasted really bad. I dumped the coffee out and made a fresh pot; same result. I installed a charcoal filter and brewed another pot. The coffee still smelled and tasted the same. Then, we cleaned the coffee maker 3 times using water with a tablespoon of white vinegar. But, the water reservoir, the coffee maker and the thermal carafe still have that terrible plastic smell. And the coffee you brew in it is absolutely not drinkable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working less then a month.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift and started using Christmas day. First the clock stopped keeping time so we could not use the programmable features. A week later the top on the carafe fell apart so it could only be used with the top off. Then the cleaning light came on but it will not run the cleaning cycle. Reached out to Mr. Coffee and was told they would send a replacement but this model doesn't exist anymore and the replacements they offer only have the glass carafe, which we do not want. Figured it was better then nothing but that was February and I am still waiting for a replacement..... Will not buy Mr. Coffee again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: 1/1/2020 - I hate changing coffee makers. Mine were lasting only a couple of years, and then that same model would be out of production. Finally I found this one that we really like, and I bought two of them! That was five years ago and the first one is still working great. Last year an electrical circuit in the kitchen went out and I thought it was the coffee pot so I bought a third one. Maybe they can bury me with one so I can be sure of having my morning coffee in heaven :)
customer_reviews.author: goodfaith

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Coffee thermal
customer_reviews.text: This is my second positive round with this brand/model. I used to only have the Bunn home model, but after a while the coffee left in the carafe tasted stale when left with the warmer on. This model does not have a warmer and uses a thermal carafe, so the coffee tastes good even after an hour. There is also a timer that beeps after two hours to let you know that the coffee "is what it is" after two hours. I think it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: sbatncpl

customer_reviews.title: our favorite one ever
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these that lasted about 5 years. The store where we purchased it no longer had it available in store or to order in so we bought another brand that had similar features. The other brand did not perform as well, was not as easy to use, and did not keep our coffee as hot as this on. After 2 months we decided to check Amazon. We love the double walled stainless steel carafe , it's ease of use, and is easy to clean. It brews and keeps our coffee nice and hot the way we like it. We were so happy to see it available on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: A. MacRae

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We were skeptical because of some of the bad reviews, but this coffee maker is excellent. Yes, it beeps. No, it's not that loud. My only complaint is, I wish the water chamber was a little easier to clean. The carafe keeps the coffee hot for several hours, even in a cold New England winter. I also fill the carafe with hot, hot water and let it sit for a minute or 2, then dump the water and place it into the coffee maker -- keeps the coffee hotter, longer.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B.

customer_reviews.title: Love it but make sure to clean often
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee ever and love that it stays fresh in the carafe longer. Make sure to clean regularly as recommended. If you wait too long to due a cleaning your coffee maker will poop out due to hard water deposits build up. Forget the keoreg waste. Happy to have a good, strong cup of coffee and a couple of warm ups later.
customer_reviews.author: Zanzibar Dihedral

customer_reviews.title: I really like this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great carafe. Keeps the coffee hot for a couple of hours. Fast. Nice hot coffee in about 8 minutes. Cleaning mode. Built in. Value: Hard to beat this quality at this price. Cons: Very large, at least for me. I don't have room for it on my counter and that makes it less convenient than it could be. Five stars for a great cup of coffee at a very decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lee, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 16 months ago. It did take several uses before the strong plastic smell started to dissipate, but once it did I loved this coffee pot and it was just what I was looking for. However, the automatic cleaning timer/feature stopped working a few months ago and then last week my coffee started to taste like crap and the carafe wasn't keeping the coffee hot. Not sure what is wrong with it, but I suppose I'll have to send it in to be serviced. At this price point it should have lasted longer. I HATE putting things in the landfill!!
customer_reviews.author: lisal

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker! Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Great 10 cup coffee maker. Has a replaceable filter which I replace every 2 weeks. Flavor of coffee is just as good if not better than my last $175 coffee maker. I love the insulated carafe as opposed to having the warming plate. The carafe keep coffee hot for at least an hour, at which point, if it had a warming plate, the coffee would be dark and burnt. Brew time is only 5 minutes, and is very hot when first brewed. Paper filters seem to work best, and make the most robust flavored pot of coffee for the amount of grinds used.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Coffee made it right for me
customer_reviews.text: The coffeemaker wasn't packaged properly. It wasn't packed in a extra box for protection. The delay brew feature never worked and water would be on my counter top the next morning and then it went completely out after about 2 months of use BUT I called the number that the book tells you to and they replaced it with proof of my receipt from Amazon and I got a brand new one from them, not Amazon. Haven't had any trouble with the new one at all and it looks pretty on my countertop. And a 10 cup is really like having 7 regular cups of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: This our second one of the same model. I have made the coffee at 4 in the morning and poured a second cup at 2 in the afternoon and there was still some steam left in the pot. The beverage wasnt burning hot but it still had some warmth to it. I like the fact that it does not continue to cook the coffee like others do, that use a hot plate. The first one lasted us probably 10 years + so hopefully this one will go as far or further.
customer_reviews.author: marco

customer_reviews.title: Lightning fast, but weak.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to use, and lightning fast brewing; but not great coffee. On the plus side, it's probably the fastest coffee maker I've ever owned. Easy to set up, but not the easiest to 'load'. The tank is too tall to fit under the filtered water dispenser on my fridge, and the coffee basket (which has to be completely removed to load) doesn't sit level when it's on the counter. Small details, but worth noting. Biggest downside is that it brews weak coffee. I attribute it to the basket filter (as opposed to a cone-type). I've started using 20% extra coffee and it still isn't as full-bodied or flavorful as my previous, cone-type brewer.
customer_reviews.author: Leemaybe

customer_reviews.title: Like the change in top
customer_reviews.text: We are hard on coffee pots and have tried many brands, so it is saying something that this is the second on we have purchased. Like the change in top...easier to fill; don't use permanent filter...very messy to empty...sticking with paper filters.
customer_reviews.author: Norman J. Gehrlein

customer_reviews.title: Be advised does not include $12 filter as descibed.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon needs to revise the product description. Despite saying it comes with a gold tone permanent filter it does not. Not even a paper one to at least be able to try it out. BTW the appropriate filter needed is another $12, plus delivery time. Additionally, they do provide one water filter, which is supposed to be changed out monthly so you'll probably want to order those too. Those are a little more than a buck a piece depending on quantity. Since I have to wait, might as well send it back and order something usable.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Carrizales

customer_reviews.title: Love This Mr. Coffee Thermal Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this coffee maker. It is truly awesome, the coffee stays hot for at least 2 hours, (haven't tested it beyond that time). The brewing time is faster than any coffee maker I have had previously and the coffee tastes really great due to the water filter. The only negative I have and it's a small one, is that sometimes when you pour your coffee a small amount will dibble out from the top hole where you press the button to open the pot lid to pour the coffee, other than that it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffe Maker Evah
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker. This is my 2nd one of this model, my first lasted about 6 years. Brews quickly amd never gets bitter since there is no burner. Coffee stays hot for 3 hours. I have brewed in the am, come home after work and the coffee was still very warm. I typically drink a pot a coffee a day, and this coffee maker is why. Great job Mr. Coffee. I really really really really really really like it. Decafe even tastes good, but I don't drink that crap.
customer_reviews.author: William T.

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately. Zero response from customer service after a week.
customer_reviews.text: The second time I used it, a spring and plastic piece fell off from somewhere. I contacted customer service using their online form with every make/model/serial/manufacturer/production number they wanted and a detailed description of the issue, and after a week I've still heard nothing. Now the coffee maker leaks everywhere if the pot isn't in place (including a dribble that drains out from the grounds after it's done brewing) which defeats the purpose of having a thermal carafe. I'd try to put it back together if it were at all clear how to do so, but the pieces don't seem to attach to anything so I can't tell if something's missing or broken.
customer_reviews.author: DrSage

customer_reviews.title: I really like this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: First of all.. I really like this coffee maker.. But love it.. Not really. Why? Well first and foremost, it has NO hot plate under it... I didn't know this when I bought it in October.. They'll say so you drink the coffee when is fresh... My whole deal is if you dont drink it fast it is cold... But the design is beautiful and the ease of filling it has never been easier for me .. Mr Coffee not all of us are able to drink a pot in the amount of time.. How about a hot plate with a switch? With an auto-off timer? You can use that idea... just send me one?!? Thanks! MG
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the coffee maker but hate the beep!
customer_reviews.text: Love the coffee maker but hate the beep!!! This is my second BVMC-PSTX91 coffee maker. It brews fast and keeps the coffee nice and hot for hours with the thermal carafe. The only complaint is the smoke detector loud beeping when the coffee is ready. I wish they would put a switch or allow you to program it off. The good news is when the screaming alarm stops and the whole house wakes up (including the dog) they will have great hot coffee waiting for them. Love hate relationship at best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee when it decides to work properly
customer_reviews.text: 9/10 times this coffee maker is great. It's a little difficult to keep clean, but worth it for a quick pot of coffee. The problem comes in when it decides to malfunction. There seems to be no rhyme or reason to why it will malfunction, but occasionally it will decide to deposit coffee on the countertop rather than in the caraffe. It brews so quickly that there's no keeping up with it and you've not only been left without a cup of coffee, but have a massive mess. This thing will be making its way into the trash this morning, it's ruined my morning for the last time.
customer_reviews.author: Alex E. Seitz

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this coffee pot...my daughter and son both have one and recommended it. But after 3 months, it now leaks as if a seal is broke. When I take the carafe off there is coffee on the platform and of course as I'm pouring my coffee it's dripping on the counter. I have only rinsed it clean in the sink, never put in a dishwasher etc... I tried to get "product support" but evidently I was too late by 3 days. I REALLY don't think a coffee pot such as this should only last 3 months, am I correct??? I sure hope the company reaches out to me.
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap parts - namely the little clip that indicates when you installed the water filter and the plastic used for the water resevior. The water filter indicator was broken when we got it. We didn't report anything because we really didn't care and had no real need for the filter. The water resevior had a small chip break off within the first week. It doesn't affect the function of the machine, so, we didn't ask for a replacement. I've purchased coffee makers for $20 - in the last year - that still have no problems. The pot is really nice. At least that was made with quality in mind. I would say it's not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle m

customer_reviews.title: Spills Regularly - Avoid like the plague
customer_reviews.text: This coffee pot is possibly the worst one I've owned in my adult life. I purchased it and within 6 months, it did nothing but leak coffee out the side where the grounds are loaded. I did all I could think of to fix the problem (cleaned it, made sure I didn't put too many grounds in, etc.) to no avail. It continues to leak. So, rather than waking up to a fresh pot of coffee, I woke up to countertops filled with coffee and a mess to clean up. It's a terrible design and I would avoid this model if I were you...unless you're a glutton for punishment.
customer_reviews.author: B. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT use anything but a paper filter
customer_reviews.text: We've used this coffee maker for several months. It works great - as long as we use a paper filter. When using a re-usable filter, sometimes we end up with coffee all over the counter and cold, weak coffee in the carafe. My theory is that the reusable filter just doesn't drain quite quickly enough, so the water builds up and overflows, taking the grounds with it. The grounds then clog the drain to the pot and... NOT a good way to wake up. Other than that, or with a paper filter, it works well, serves up hot, tasty coffee and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Deken Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great long lasting coffee brewer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one in 2016 and its still working great,dough this was a second one,sins the first one was returned ,for having sighs of being used or opened item and had a small dent on the stainless carafe...Now just a reminder, If you end up purchasing this one, It will beep when done...and it will beep continuously, if you turn it on, without you first putting water in its bucket ,its not a defect of the coffeemaker if this happens. As stated before, it has work till this day like a champ, and with heavy use by my family sins 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Michael Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: It leaks....a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this coffee maker but unfortunately will be returning it today. The unit leaks really bad. I’m assuming this is just a flaw in the unit I purchased but it’s making a huge mess far too frequently. Attached is an image and video of this mornings mess. This is truly a bummer since now I will have to look for yet another coffee maker. I think I’ll be trying something other than a Mr Coffee brand. If anyone has any recommendations please share. I’m open to suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: carlynnixon

customer_reviews.title: 6 Month Life Span
customer_reviews.text: The carafe does not keep the coffee hot for long after the heat turns off. The brew is very fast. It would be better if it also had an option for bold brew. The top of the water reservoir is completely unattached which seems cheap and is inconvenient to use. Overall, it’s an ok coffee maker for the price. ***After only 6 months, the coffee pot did not brew all 10 cups and the Clean light stayed on all the time, even after following cleaning process. I would not waste your money on this!
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Nice and simple
customer_reviews.text: really got sick of my Nepresso vertuolino pod coffee maker-$$ coffee, order online, no flavor choices I liked,etc. Really glad I went back to real coffee as I am back to choosing flavors and intensities I like. This keeps coffee warm long enough for me-I am an AM drinker before work for the most part so coffee is drunk within 1 hour of brewing. I did not want machine I had to remember to turn off with a heated warming plate. It is easy to use and perfect.
customer_reviews.author: vetmom

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic coffee generates compliments.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second identical machine for personal use. That does not count the three machines we bought as gifts. Who buys FIVE coffee makers? Only someone who is very satisfied with performance and quality and ease of use. The folks we have the other machines are also happy with their gifts. Why did we replace? Nothing lasts forever and we got our money's worth from this.
customer_reviews.author: 12nick

customer_reviews.title: Great machine at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I’m a little bit of a coffee snob so all I could do is 4 stars on taste. That said, machine is easy to use, easy to clean, makes really hot coffee (which is key for me), and is affordable. One setback is it does not come with the Goldtone filter like it says in the description, so you have to buy that separately. I’ve only had this for a couple months so I can’t speak to longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Prochazkova Daly

customer_reviews.title: After receiving one that did not work
customer_reviews.text: You might wonder why I didn’t give the coffee maker a five star rating. It works great and makes great coffee. The reason is that the first one sent would not work and there were a lot of hurtles to jump over and hoops to go through to prove to them that we were telling the truth about the first one not working. It took some time and effort but they finally sent us another one. We have used this stile of maker from Mr. Coffee for years so we made the effort to get a functioning coffee maker.”
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Bauknight

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much, bought a second for work and at home!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a shared office of 25-30 people about two years ago, loved it so much that I bought one for home! Fastest coffee maker I've ever used. Water reservoir is more like a Keurig machine than a traditional coffee machine, so the top does not need to flip up and can fit under a kitchen cabinet. Love that it does not have a hot plate, which I feel is a safety hazard. The insulated carafe stays warm for hours depending on how much coffee is in it.
customer_reviews.author: John R Ware

customer_reviews.title: Product is questionable.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this coffeemaker about a month ago. Yesterday it was preset to brew so I took my dog for a walk. Not sure what happened but when we got back it's as if the coffee had exploded!!!!! There was coffee all over the counter running onto the cabinets and floor. Wet coffee grinds were everywhere! It was a horrible mess. Now I'm wary of using it!!! Has this happened to anyone else? Such a shame!!!
customer_reviews.author: The old Spider.

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker ever!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our current coffee maker because I kept breaking the glass pot. Saw some good reviews on this Mr. Coffee maker. Wow - what a difference! The coffee tastes 100% better AND it stays hot for hours. Hubby and I wake up at different times and now we can set the coffee to drip early and always be assured of hot coffee (if one of us doesn't drink it all). Love this product! Easy to make the coffee (removable bin for the water) and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela M

customer_reviews.title: Fast, weak coffee
customer_reviews.text: This machine advertises "Faster, hotter, better". The coffee is nicely hot but the water runs thru the grounds so fast it is weak. Good French Roast tastes like 7-11 decaf. I spent a good amount of time on the phone with MrCoffee customer service but they didn't have a fix. They said other models have a brew strength switch but they weren't sure how that worked. I experimented and found that the amount of ground coffee I used to use with my Cusinart for 10 cups will make 6 cups with this. Doubling my coffee costs and the inconvenience of making 2 pots in the morning will probably cause this to go into ready reserve status.
customer_reviews.author: JP1

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee pot!  Best price on Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one of this coffee pot because our other one finally broke down after over 10 years of daily use . We were very happy with this coffee pot -no issues. It’s nice that it has a timer so you can set it to come on whenever you want and the carafe keeps the coffee warm for quite a while . He could make up to 10 cups and we have been very happy with it - great price!
customer_reviews.author: Just my opinion

customer_reviews.title: Inferior
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this coffee maker for a few months now. I Purchased it because I wanted an insulated carafe for the coffee after it brews. Well, the digital display went completely black after one month, you have to be super careful when making your coffee or you’ll come out to coffee all over your counter, and lastly, I don’t feel the coffee is hot enough. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Ineedsun

customer_reviews.title: It is super easy to empty the filter basket
customer_reviews.text: I am new to coffee having mostly drank energy drinks, but started drinking dark coffee in order to cut down on sugar. This was the first coffee machine I have bought and I'm very impressed. I haven't used the timer functionality so I can't discuss that. It is super easy to empty the filter basket. It is also easy to add water. Makes coffee very quickly and stays at a very warm drinkable temp for several hours afterwards. There have been no steam issues with it placed under my kitchen cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Gorm

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee pot. I have been using versions of it for years. I do have to use a stronger blend of coffee to get it right but I have figured it out and look forward to drinking my big cup of coffee every morning. I particularly like that there is no hot plate because I have kitty cats in the house. There are much more expensive similar style coffee makers but this one has been working for me just fine so I am sticking with it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Caplan

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if you can get a better Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if you can get a better Coffee Maker, because this one has been designed in a way to you get MOST OF THE FLAVOR from the coffee bean grinned ... We got it friday around 6 PM and 15 minutes later we were enjoying the most delicious coffee in years ... Our coffee beans are freshly kept on vacuum sealed containers, our coffee grinder works perfectly but with this new coffee maker the flavor is like coming from Heaven. Is not only really hot, which I love but the flavor is the best, I will recommend this coffee maker all day long. And lucky me I bought for $59.99 come on !!!
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Marco Villatoro

customer_reviews.title: nice looking machine, average coffee
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take to work. I'm glad its not my home brewing machine. In order to get a decent strength coffee you must remove the water filter. It's poorly designed to filter after heating up the water. I found that with the filter in place the coffee was more like tea. Taking it out makes a serviceable cup of coffee. However I can tell that the water isn't brewing hot enough or soaking the beans correctly as the coffee lacks the flavor profiles I get out of my Technivorm with the exact same beans. Un summary perfect for your pot of folgers but pass if you're grinding your own beans and care about the flavor of your coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Seal Kojac

customer_reviews.title: Leaks from bottom
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this 5 stars but it has a major problem - it leaks from the bottom. I went to the Mr. Coffee website and A LOT of people were complaining of the same thing. It doesn’t leak every single time, maybe 1 in 3, but it’s enough to make it a pain. It does keep the coffee hot for a long time and makes great coffee so I’ll be keeping the coffee pot, just really annoying that I have to clean the counter after almost every pot.
customer_reviews.author: MDH

product_meta.title: Mr. Coffee 10 Cup Coffee Maker | Optimal Brew Thermal System
product_meta.description: Color:Black/ChromeMr. Coffee's Optimal Brew Thermal Coffee Maker System is designed to extract the fullest flavor possible from your favorite roast. It boasts a high brew temperature of up to 205° with a brew speed that's 20% faster (than competitive units tested). Its double-walled, stainless steel thermal carafe maintains temperature without a warming plate, which preserves your coffee's true flavor profile. The Delay Brew function lets you schedule a pot for later, so you can wake up to a rejuvinating cup every morning. And Grab-A-Cup Auto Pause allows you to pour a cup before the brew cycle finishes. Be sure to use the included water filtration disk to remove any chlorine or impurities from your water during brewing, so you can enjoy a pure tasting cup every time.
feature_bullets: Removable water reservoir for easy filling
Just Brewed thermal carafe holds temperature and fresh flavor. Watts - 1300
Brews up to 20 percent faster (than competitive units tested) at a hotter temperature of up to 205 for richer taste
Gold Tone permanent filter eliminates paper filter cost and waste; water filtration helps remove up to 97 percent of chlorine for better tasting coffee
Delay Brew feature sets brew time ahead so you can wake up to fresh brewed coffee; Freshness Timer keeps a tab on coffee freshness from the time it's brewed
